html: In 2019, it is outrageous that on average full-time working women earn just 80 cents for every dollar a man earns. Today, the House passed the #PaycheckFairnessAct to strengthen protections against gender-based wage discrimination. Men and women deserve #EqualPayForEqualWork.
text:
In 2019, it is outrageous that on average full-time working women earn just 80 cents for every dollar a man earns.

Today, the House passed the #PaycheckFairnessAct to strengthen protections against gender-based wage discrimination.

Men and women deserve #EqualPayForEqualWork.

html: For those below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level, there is absolutely no cost sharing. Zero. For individuals and families between 200% and 600% FPL, premiums are established on a sliding scale, but no one will pay more that 9% of their adjusted monthly gross income.
text: For those below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level, there is absolutely no cost sharing. Zero. For individuals and families between 200% and 600% FPL, premiums are established on a sliding scale, but no one will pay more that 9% of their adjusted monthly gross income.

html: There’s much more to say, but thank you for making it this far. We are hard at work making revisions based on feedback, including from some of the comments we’ve seen on Twitter! We’re proud of our vision for #Med4America, and look forward to sharing the new bill soon.
text: There’s much more to say, but thank you for making it this far. We are hard at work making revisions based on feedback, including from some of the comments we’ve seen on Twitter! We’re proud of our vision for #Med4America, and look forward to sharing the new bill soon.

html: For primary, mental & behavioral health, the Secretary will increase those reimbursement rates by at least 30%. Why? Individuals on Medicare & Medicaid face tremendous barriers in attaining primary & mental health care. What good is coverage if no doctor in your area takes it?
text: For primary, mental & behavioral health, the Secretary will increase those reimbursement rates by at least 30%. Why? Individuals on Medicare & Medicaid face tremendous barriers in attaining primary & mental health care. What good is coverage if no doctor in your area takes it?

html: Since some things are going to be covered for the first time, the Secretary of HHS will be establishing those rates. #Med4America will be negotiating prescription drug prices, and a quick note, #Med4America has all-payer rate setting.
text: Since some things are going to be covered for the first time, the Secretary of HHS will be establishing those rates. #Med4America will be negotiating prescription drug prices, and a quick note, #Med4America has all-payer rate setting.

html: Spoiler alert: there will be no deductible when we reintroduce #Med4America. We will have a maximum out of pocket of $3500/$5000 (on a sliding scale). Things exempt from cost-sharing: preventive/chronic disease services, LTSS, and most prescription drugs.
text: Spoiler alert: there will be no deductible when we reintroduce #Med4America. We will have a maximum out of pocket of $3500/$5000 (on a sliding scale). Things exempt from cost-sharing: preventive/chronic disease services, LTSS, and most prescription drugs.

html: Beyond adding dental, vision, and hearing, #Med4America includes Long-Term Services and Supports—one the most important benefits we include. No health system is truly universal unless it covers LTSS. Check out Section 2203. #AllMeansAll https://delauro.house.gov/sites/delauro.house.gov/files/Medicare_for_America_Act_.pdf …
text: Beyond adding dental, vision, and hearing, #Med4America includes Long-Term Services and Supports—one the most important benefits we include. No health system is truly universal unless it covers LTSS. Check out Section 2203. #AllMeansAll https://delauro.house.gov/sites/delauro.house.gov/files/Medicare_for_America_Act_.pdf …

html: Many have said Medicaid for all would be better because the benefits covered are better than Medicare. That’s why the #Med4America benefits package is based on Connecticut’s HUSKY. An extensive list ensures that every American has the same strong set of benefits.
text: Many have said Medicaid for all would be better because the benefits covered are better than Medicare. That’s why the #Med4America benefits package is based on Connecticut’s HUSKY. An extensive list ensures that every American has the same strong set of benefits.

html: Right now in the U.S., health coverage is determined by zip code. Medicaid and state mandates vary drastically, and if our goal is universal coverage, we can no longer have a system where states decide what benefits to cover.
text: Right now in the U.S., health coverage is determined by zip code. Medicaid and state mandates vary drastically, and if our goal is universal coverage, we can no longer have a system where states decide what benefits to cover.

html: #Med4America does allow for employers to provide coverage as long as it is gold level. Far too many employers have become less generous while wages have not increased. Employers can also enroll their employees into #Med4America. Or you as an employee can pick #Med4America
text: #Med4America does allow for employers to provide coverage as long as it is gold level. Far too many employers have become less generous while wages have not increased. Employers can also enroll their employees into #Med4America. Or you as an employee can pick #Med4America

html: FYI: Medicare for America is not a public option. It auto-enrolls newborns from birth, everyone who is uninsured at any time, those on exchange plans into #Med4America. We transition seniors currently on Medicare/Medicaid/CHIP into #Med4America.

html: In 2015, 9 innocent people were gunned down at the Emanuel AME Church in Charleston, SC. The gun used was sold even though the background check wasn't completed. It's past time for thoughts and prayers. We need action. #HR1112 is an important first step.pic.twitter.com/tW3nmaD9wV
text:
In 2015, 9 innocent people were gunned down at the Emanuel AME Church in Charleston, SC.

The gun used was sold even though the background check wasn't completed.
 
It's past time for thoughts and prayers.
 
We need action. #HR1112 is an important first step.pic.twitter.com/tW3nmaD9wV

Workers should not be forced to choose between their job and taking care of a new child, family member, or their own health. 

I am proud to support the #FAMILYAct, legislation to create a national #PaidLeave program.

Care for a new child

html: On employer-sponsored insurance: some people love theirs, others don’t. Our solution: if employers offer gold level coverage, great! If not, they either have to or they can put their employees on #Med4America and make a contribution. And workers can always choose #Med4America.
text: On employer-sponsored insurance: some people love theirs, others don’t. Our solution: if employers offer gold level coverage, great! If not, they either have to or they can put their employees on #Med4America and make a contribution. And workers can always choose #Med4America.

html: It also tackles the Hyde Amendment. Under #Med4America we ensure all reproductive health care is covered. We're also able to end Hyde-like riders for the Indian Health Service, women's veterans healthcare, and health care in ICE detention facilities.
text: It also tackles the Hyde Amendment. Under #Med4America we ensure all reproductive health care is covered. We're also able to end Hyde-like riders for the Indian Health Service, women's veterans healthcare, and health care in ICE detention facilities.

html: #Med4America also includes Long-Term Services & Supports as a part of the universal service package. We cannot have a conversation about universal coverage if we do not include robust home and community-based LTSS.
text: #Med4America also includes Long-Term Services & Supports as a part of the universal service package. We cannot have a conversation about universal coverage if we do not include robust home and community-based LTSS.

html: Like its benefits package. Healthcare should not be determined by your zip code. Unfortunately in our current system it is. #Med4America sets a high threshold for benefits so that all Americans get the same covered benefits and services.
text: Like its benefits package. Healthcare should not be determined by your zip code. Unfortunately in our current system it is. #Med4America sets a high threshold for benefits so that all Americans get the same covered benefits and services.

html: Despite making up half the workforce, women on average still make just 80 cents for every dollar a man makes. We must close the #wagegap and ensure women receive equal pay for equal work.
text: Despite making up half the workforce, women on average still make just 80 cents for every dollar a man makes.  We must close the #wagegap and ensure women receive equal pay for equal work.

html: The #PaycheckFairnessAct would hold employers accountable for discriminatory practices, end the practice of pay secrecy, ease workers’ ability to challenge pay discrimination, strengthen remedies for wronged employees, and prohibit employers from seeking salary histories.
text: The #PaycheckFairnessAct would hold employers accountable for discriminatory practices, end the practice of pay secrecy, ease workers’ ability to challenge pay discrimination, strengthen remedies for wronged employees, and prohibit employers from seeking salary histories.

html: It's been 55 years since the #EqualPayAct became law, yet women still do not get equal pay for equal work. The #PaycheckFairnessAct would make real progress in the fight to eliminate the wage gap for women, families, and our economy as a whole.pic.twitter.com/OiAhYINVWo
text: It's been 55 years since the #EqualPayAct became law, yet women still do not get equal pay for equal work. The #PaycheckFairnessAct would make real progress in the fight to eliminate the wage gap for women, families, and our economy as a whole.pic.twitter.com/OiAhYINVWo

html: I can’t say I’m surprised that the President’s proposals are just another gift to Big Pharma. I will continue to fight lower prices, and stop the price gouging.

html: My bill would protect consumers from misinformation and advertising that promotes unnecessarily expensive prescription drugs
text: My bill would protect consumers from misinformation and advertising that promotes unnecessarily expensive prescription drugs

html: Finally, I’ve introduced the Responsibility in Drug Advertising Act that places a three-year ban on direct-to-consumer advertising of newly approved prescription drugs.
text: Finally, I’ve introduced the Responsibility in Drug Advertising Act that places a three-year ban on direct-to-consumer advertising of newly approved prescription drugs.

html: I’ve also long supported the Affordable and Safe Prescription Drug Importation Act, which would allow individuals and pharmacies to buy drugs from other countries that are equally as safe as drugs sold here, but significantly more affordable.
text: I’ve also long supported the Affordable and Safe Prescription Drug Importation Act, which would allow individuals and pharmacies to buy drugs from other countries that are equally as safe as drugs sold here, but significantly more affordable.

html: My bill would give the government the authority to regulate the price of prescription drugs and ensure no American’s health is threatened by corporations who put profits above people.
text: My bill would give the government the authority to regulate the price of prescription drugs and ensure no American’s health is threatened by corporations who put profits above people.

html: This week, I introduced the Prescription Drug and Medical Device Price Review Board Act, which prevents drug and medical device companies from gouging consumers with excessive prices.
text: This week, I introduced the Prescription Drug and Medical Device Price Review Board Act, which prevents drug and medical device companies from gouging consumers with excessive prices.

html: The President should have kept his promise and allowed Medicare to negotiate to lower drug prices. I’m proud to be a cosponsor of the Medicare Prescription Drug Price Negotiation Act, which would help our seniors.
text: The President should have kept his promise and allowed Medicare to negotiate to lower drug prices. I’m proud to be a cosponsor of the Medicare Prescription Drug Price Negotiation Act, which would help our seniors.
